Articles.Content:
Challenge timeframe:-

Estimated: 30 minutes or less, depend on your skill.

Challenge Instruction:-

Create a new Sandbox game. Download and replace the new game with the following persistent file.

persistent.sfs download

Challenge guideline.

1) Go to Minmus.

2) Play [Kerbal Xx]. (Tips: Kerbal Xx is orbiting Minmus at altitude about 6km)

3) EVA a crew member. Double click [Kerbal Xx] set it as target.

4) Descend to Minmus surface using EVA Jet Pack.

5) Plan a flag.

6) Return to [Kerbal Xx] by using the EVA Jet Pack. (Tips: Wait until the right moment. Game time will not be judge for winning the challenge.)

Challenge Rules.

1) [Kerbal Xx] must not be switch to "play/move" at any time, except selecting a crew member for EVA. (Means, Change of [Kerbal Xx] angle or altitude are forbidden.)

2) Screenshot or video proof.

  • a) Screenshot while, Planted a flag, with [Kerbal Xx] showing how many km/meter away at the background.
  • A maneuver node encounter distance screenshot, showing 2km or less between you and the [Kerbal Xx].
  • c) Screenshot showing you are grabbing the ladder of [Kerbal Xx] with [F:Board] on screen, and show your EVA Jet Pack remaining gas value. And the planted flag as background.
  • d) Finally, enter the pod, and show the [resource tap] that you are not using any bit of fuel, mono-gas. With the planted flag as background.

Winner rewards.

1) A logo showing (Your Forum ID) that you are capable of performing advance EVA.

2) Remaining EVA value will be shown at the logo.

3) "Star" rewards for video recording.

Leader board.

Most EVA value left.

Attempting this challenge, but it looks like the Kerbal Xx is in a too low orbit and gets destroyed after 3 or so orbits.

It seems that's true. I've manage to complete the mission in time. And not notice that.

However, I will now pull the craft to 6000 meter.

Completed this challenge (with the supplied savefile) only to notice I didn't look too carefully at the required screenshot rules. Hopefully this is enough, if not I won't mind redoing it.

EVA fuel left: 15.3%

I accept your challenge!

I have done several EVA landing on Minmus in version 0.1.8 so I gues I could do it in 0.2.2. And I ususaly had more RCS fuel left.

EDIT: Did my first atempt. Landed sucsessfully (sliding for a few kilometers ). But then take off and return was't sucessfull as I tilted my orbit since I have been orienting by suns position which was a mistake.

I would post screnshots but Imgur doesn't want to upload them (46 of them).

I tried recording video but my laptop is not good enough to run both KSP and Fraps wihtout considerable slowdowns and "hickups".

Edited November 1, 2013 by SilverWarior

Well-done Johnno. You always the best.

@SilverWarior Welcome to the challenge, hope that you post your success attempt soon.

Tips, converting your .PNG screenshot to .JPG image type will let Imgur more than happy to accept them.

Free converter software.. http://download.cnet.com/Bulk-Image-Converter/3000-2192_4-10794624.html

@Sirine

Thank you for your suggestion about converting images to JPG format.

Edited November 2, 2013 by SilverWarior

Tomorrow I'll post an entry too, since I'm not home now.

But I think this challenge would be better if we would have to touchdown smoothly, because if this gets serious, it will come down to who can crash better, to use less fuel for the landing.

But I think this challenge would be better if we would have to touchdown smoothly, because if this gets serious, it will come down to who can crash better, to use less fuel for the landing.

I see you realized the advantage of my "landing" approach

Landing smothy with minimal vertical speed would probably increase RCS fuel consumption about 5 to 10 percent. That is if you are landing on top of the mountain. Some more if you are landing to one of the frozen lakes.

EDIT:

But the problem is that without the video you have no way of saying whether someone landed using such approach or not it this becomes a disqualifying condition. If I wouldn't have shown all those shots of "sliding landing" you would have never guesed I used such approach.

Edited November 2, 2013 by SilverWarior

@APhobius, SilverWarior thanks for taking part in the challenge. Wish you guys good luck in next try.

The landing part is not important, as long as you do not "crash kill" your crew, I don't really care how far they sliding away.

There are only 4 screenshots that are vital. Please refer to 1st thread.

It's not any sort of record-breaker, but it is pretty nifty for what I pulled off on re-intercept. To wit!

Jeb got down there perhaps not with optimal fuel left, but certainly with more than enough to get back to the ship.

Where it gets interesting is when I was going up to intercept with the ship. As you can see, I nailed the initial encounter perfectly.

That said, it was a less-than-perfect intercept since it ate up a fair bit of RCS.

Anyway, I pulled that off. Fun times.

@SkyRender Thanks for taking part in the challenge. Congratulation on your successfully dock with Kerbal Xx. and excellent intercept.

Your logo will be ready in no times. (Optional to display as always.)

About the landing ... don't say that I haven't told you.

EDIT: Hahaha, forgot the flag, eh, since it's a video, I don't think it would make any difference. Anyway, I'm at work now and I can't make a new one until tomorrow.
